title: Area Principle: The area of a bin is equal to the percentage of data in the bin. The larger the area, the more data lies in that bin.
text: area of a bar $$=$$ % of values in a bin $$=$$ width of the bin × height of the bin

title: Calculation Fraction
text: Height of the bar $$=$$ area of the bar in percent / height of the bin

title: Determining area of the bar
text: What is the area of the bar compared to the entire area of the distribution as a percentage?

title: Determining width of bar
text: What is the width of the bar in dollars?
